comments:
This course is an introduction to processes and forces that form the surface and
the interior of the Earth. Topics include changes in climate and the history of life, and
earth resources and their uses.
Students felt that the course was “interesting,” but also found the large amount of
information “overwhelming” at times.
Students called Profesor Omar a “character” and found his lectures “engaging.”
He was often described as “energetic,” “funny,” and able to make the topic as interesting
as possible. On the other hand, some found him a bit “detail-oriented.”
Many students complained about the length and detail-oriented nature of the tests.
Many students took this class to fulfill the “Physical World” sector requirement.
